title: Senior Backend Engineer - Regional Expansion
content:
Wise is one the fastest growing companies in Europe and we’re on a mission: to make money without borders the new normal. We’ve got 15 million customers across the globe and we’re growing. Fast.
Current banking systems don't let us send, spend or receive money across borders easily. Or quickly. Or cheaply. 
So, we’re building a new one.
And, we need a Backend Engineer with a Java focus to join our mission and help us build a global platform that’s scalable, reliable and secure. We’re working on lots of algorithmical challenges, and you’ll dive right into projects on reconciliation, integrations, authorisations and authentications.
The team you will join: Europe Onboarding team
We are working on building the most convenient and scalable onboarding experience for people and businesses, which is compliant with local regulatory guidelines.
We want onboarding to be convenient, our customers should know what is required from them, and at what point of onboarding. We also care about effectiveness: only ask from the customer what we really need, easy for them to provide and is effective at stopping fincrime.
We want onboarding to be scalable. We are working on automating the process for our team, any way we can. We are working with LLMs, building internal tools, and working with vendors.
We want onboarding to be compliant with regulatory guidelines.
What does it take?  
A strong product mindset and passion for user experience, you prioritise work with the customers in mind and  make data-driven decisions to fix customer pain-points
Great communication skills and the ability to articulate complex, technical concepts to non-technical audience
Experience working with relational and non-relational databases, query optimisation and designing schemas
You enjoy writing testable code and believe in Test Driven Development
You have 4+ years of Java 8 plus knowledge, experience with Spring framework and database abstraction layers like Hibernate
You believe in and follow best coding practices, code reviews and open feedback
Experience with CI/CD pipelines and Distributed and Concurrent Systems
Hands on knowledge of system integration patterns 
What does success look like?
You’ll have onboarded and found your place through understanding your team and tribe vision and how you can contribute
You’ll understand how our values can help you guide your work
You’ll understand the reasons behind problematic payments and customer difficulties and how to go about solving them
You’ll be raising the automation level to enable scaling of the product
Understand our customers and the impact our product makes in their lives 
You’ll help us scale-up and build a world class money transfer product by finding solutions to our technical challenges and opportunities
What you get back:
The empowerment to solve problems your way
The freedom to have real impact
Loads of development opportunities 
A fun work environment with social activities and events
The opportunity to work with super smart people
The salary ranges between HUF1,500,000 - HUF2,200,000/month with an RSU package. 
Furthermore, find out more about our benefits in our  Budapest  office. 
Interested? Find out more:
👀 How we work - a practical guide
📹 Wise Vlogs: Omar, Engineering Lead 
💻 The Wise Tech Stack, 2022 edition
📈 Our Engineering career map
...or check out our Engineering blog.
We’re people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We want to work with the best people, no matter their background. So if you’re passionate about learning new things and keen to join our mission, you’ll fit right in.
Also, qualifications aren’t that important to us. If you’ve got great experience, and you’re great at articulating your thinking, we’d like to hear from you.
And because we believe that diverse teams build better products, we’d especially love to hear from you if you’re from an under-represented demographic.
#LI-ZK1Salary (monthly)1 500 000 Ft—2 200 000 Ft HUFWe're people without borders — without judgement or prejudice, too. We believe teams are strongest when they are diverse, equitable and inclusive. We're proud to have a truly international team, and we celebrate our differences.
Every Wiser should feel that they can be themselves at work. Inclusive teams help us live our values and make sure every Wiser feels respected, empowered to share their contributions towards mission zero and able to progress in their careers.
Having diverse teams that reflect our diverse customer base helps us build a better product. We can be more creative and empathetic to our customer's needs and life experiences and makes sure we leave no-one behind on our journey to mission-zero.
If you want to find out more about what it's like to work at Wise visit Wise.Jobs.
Keep up to date with life at Wise by following us on LinkedIn and Instagram.

demographic_questions.header: Wise Diversity and Inclusion - Voluntary Demographic Questions
demographic_questions.description:
The following voluntary questions are intended to help us learn about the various identities and backgrounds that make up the candidates applying to Wise. If you don't feel comfortable answering you can select I don't wish to answer.

Providing us with this information will help us take actions that support underrepresented groups and make sure our hiring process is inclusive and fair for everyone.

The questions may be sensitive to some, please know your survey responses are secure and optional. All data will be handled anonymously, aggregated and not linked to you.There will be no adverse consequences if you do not wish to complete this questionnaire, or if you partially complete it or you select ‘prefer not to say’ to any question. It will in no way impact your opportunity to work for us within the application or hiring process.

Our privacy policy explains how we collect and process your data in accordance with applicable data protection laws. If you have any questions, please email hiring-privacy@wise.com.

questions.label: What gender identity do you most closely identify with?
I identify my race/ethnicity as (mark all that apply):

answer_options.label: Black or of African or Caribbean descent

questions.label: Do you live with a disability? (Disability covers mental and physical health impairments or conditions, including things like anxiety, visual or hearing impairments, long-term health conditions)
How did you hear about this job?
Have you used Wise as a customer?
Are you eligible to work in Hungary?
If you currently hold a visa for Hungary, please tell us which one and when will it expire?
What's your desired gross salary, monthly in HUF?
